image:image.image:title: Axe Aftershave Denim

image:image.image:caption: Gits Dahi Vada are yummy Urad (Lentil) dal vada which are deep fried &amp;amp; soaked in yogurt. Topped with tamarind sauce &amp;amp; garnished with popular Indian spices. It's a delight to eat and one of the delicious Indian snack.
image:image.image:title: Gits Dahi Vada Mix

image:image.image:caption: A traditional South Indian snack prepared from fermented Rice-lentil batter &amp;amp; fried crisp brown-similar to pancake. It can be prepared in just three easy steps. Just mix water and prepare the batter and then fry on pan.
image:image.image:title: Gits Dosai Mix

image:image.image:caption: A specialty of Western Indian, State of Gujarat. Khaman Dhokla is a popular traditional snack made from fermented chick pea batter Just make in three easy steps. Mix Oil and water and prepare the batter. Pour in a pressure cooker, steam and garnish.
image:image.image:title: Gits Khaman Dhokla Mix

image:image.image:caption: A traditional popular anytime snack originally from Gujarat in West India- Dhokla is a steamed preparation made from fermented batter of rice &amp;amp; lentils with a tangy sour taste. Just make in three easy steps. Mix Oil, curd and water and prepare the batter. Pour in a pressure cooker, steam and garnish.
image:image.image:title: Gits Khatta Dhokla Mix

image:image.image:caption: Savoury fried doughnut like snack made from fermented Urad lentil dough. Just make in three easy steps. Mix in water and prepare the batter. Add Indian spices and keep aside. Divide it in 18 equal parts and mould them into doughnut shape. Deep fry them.
image:image.image:title: Gits Medu Vadai Mix

image:image.image:caption: Mildly spiced dumplings made of moong (lentil) flour, deep fried golden brown. Enjoy crisp &amp;amp; crunchy moong dal vadas with Chutney and Ketchup. Mix in water and prepare the batter. Add Indian spices and keep aside. Divide it in 22 equal parts and mould them into round shape. Deep fry them.
image:image.image:title: Gits Moong Dal Vada Mix

image:image.image:caption: An alternative to the traditional South Indian, Rice-Lentil. Dosai, Rava Dosai is made from semolina tempered sesame &amp;amp; cumin and fried in a flat circular shape. It can be prepared in just three easy steps. Just mix water and prepare the batter and then fry on pan.
image:image.image:title: Gits Rava Dosai Mix

image:image.image:caption: An alternative to the spicy steamed semolina cake rice-lentil, Idli Rava Idli is made from semolina, tempered with spices, blended with yoghurt &amp;amp; steamed. It can be prepared in just three easy steps. Just mix water and prepare the batter and steam in pressure cooker.
image:image.image:title: Gits Rava Idli Mix

image:image.image:caption: A traditional breakfast of South Indian origin, made from fermented batter of rice &amp;amp; lentil. It can be prepared in just three easy steps. Just mix water and prepare the batter and steam in pressure cooker.
image:image.image:title: Gits Rice Idli Mix

image:image.image:caption: A South Indian staple Sour &amp;amp; spicy curry made of lentils and vegetables, tempered with spices. A must with Idlis, Dosais and white rice. Prepare in just 3 easy steps. Empty the whole content in a bowl and add 1200 ml of water. Add tomatoes and other vegetables. Boil the mixture.
image:image.image:title: Gits Sambhar Mix

image:image.image:caption: An imaginative creation of Gujarat. Two people snacks, &quot;Khatta Dhokla&quot; &amp;amp; &quot;Khaman Dhokla&quot; joined by a layer of tasty green chutney to give an altogether new and delicious treat. Just prepare both Khamat dhokla and khatta dhokla. Now apply chutney, that comes with this pack only, over khatta dhokla and put khaman dhokla on top of it. Resteam it.
image:image.image:title: Gits Sandwich Dhokla Mix

image:image.image:caption: A favourite south Indian Breakfast. Also a tea time snack, made from semolina tempered with spices. Its a all time favourite snack and can be prepared in just three easy steps. Boil water and add the contents of Gits Upma mix. Stir well and simmer.
image:image.image:title: Gits Upma Mix

image:image.image:caption: Its like soft thin pizza made of Rice-lentil batter and pan-fried. Traditionally topped with chopped onions, tomato, green chillies etc. With Gits Uttappam Mix you can prepare this tasty snack in just three easy steps. Pour the contents into a bowl and mix water. Pour and spread batter on a pan and fry. Serve hot.
image:image.image:title: Gits Uttappam Mix

image:image.image:caption: A specialty of Western Indian State of Gujarat, Nylon Khaman is popular traditional snack made from fermented chana dal batter. Mix Oil and water and prepare the batter. Pour in a pressure cooker, steam and garnish.
image:image.image:title: Gits Nylon Khaman

image:image.image:caption: A Traditional &amp;amp; popular sweet of thickened and caramelized milk. It is served at the conclusion of meals. It's very delicious Indian sweet and is hard to resist. Prepare this healthy and tasty dessert with Gits Basundi in just 3 easy steps. Pour the content in milk and then boil. Serve hot or cold.
image:image.image:title: Gits Basundi Mix

image:image.image:caption: This famous Soufflé is made not only in Mumbai but is cherished all over Asia especially China, Japan, Philippines &amp;amp; Malaysia. Its satiating characteristic makes it favourite for weight-watchers. While it`s cooling nature helps beat the heat in summer. Prepare in just 3 easy steps with Gits. Mix in milk and boil the content while continuously stirring it. Pour and then set.
image:image.image:title: Gits Bombay Halwa Mix

image:image.image:caption: An Indian sweet preparation traditionally made out of evaporated milk blended with wheat flour, fried &amp;amp; soaked in sugar syrup. Now you can make this delicious Indian dessert in just 3 steps with Gits Gulab Jamun Mix. First add water and mould into small round spheres. Fry and then put them into sugar syrup.
image:image.image:title: Gits Gulab Jamun Mix

image:image.image:caption: A rich Indian sweet traditionally made out of evaporated desiccated milk, stuffed with assorted nuts, fried and soaked in sugar syrup. Now you can also make this delicious Indian dessert in just 3 steps with Gits Gulab Jamun Mix. First add water and mould into small round spheres. Fry and then put them into sugar syrup.
image:image.image:title: Gits Shahi Gulab Jamun

image:image.image:caption: Traditional, crispy, juice, saffron hued Indian sweet made from fermented batter of wheat flour &amp;amp; lentil. The batter is extruded in pretzel like shape, deep-fried and dipped in sugar syrup for few seconds. Jilebies are traditionally enjoyed in India as breakfast with glass of milk. Prepare in 3 easy steps. Mix with water. Put the batter inside a funnel or cloth. Make shape of jilebi in hot oil.
image:image.image:title: Gits Jilebi Mix

image:image.image:caption: A traditional popular favourite North Indian sweet made by thickening milk in open pan. This can be enjoyed as it is or as accompaniment with crisp Jilebies. Enjoy this great Indian sweet with Gits Rabdi Mix in just 3 easy steps. Mix the content in Milk. Stir and boil. Freeze after boiling and serve chilled.
image:image.image:title: Gits Rabdi Mix

image:image.image:caption: A specialty sweet of Bengal in North East India made from Indian cottage cheese, boiled in sugar syrup, soaked in thickened milk, garnished with Saffron &amp;amp; dry fruits. Enjoy this great Indian sweet at home with Gits Rasmalai Mix in few easy steps. First add milk and ghee to the mix and prepare discs. Now boil in water and then soak in sugar syrup. Take other pouch and prepare milk mix. Add discs.
image:image.image:title: Gits Rasmalai Mix

image:image.image:caption: This is the Indian name of milk &amp;amp; vermicelli dessert of Iranian origin called &quot;Sheer Khorma&quot; in Persian. It is laced with dry fruits and saffron and is a must at festivals &amp;amp; celebrations. Enjoy this great Indian sweet with Gits Vermicelli Kheer Mix in just 3 easy steps. Mix the content in Milk. Stir and boil. Serve hot or cold.
image:image.image:title: Gits Vermicelli Kheer Mix

image:image.image:caption: A delicious Indian Sweet traditionally made by evaporating milk to a soft solid. It is also known as 'Malai Burfi' in India. This Indian sweet is delight to eat. Can be prepared in 3 easy steps with Gits Kalakand Mix. First add ghee and milk to the content. Then stir and boil. Pour it into some container and lets it set. Cut into desired shape.
image:image.image:title: Gits Kalakand

image:image.image:caption: Tender green peas and delicious potatoes cooked in a curry of onions, tomatoes &amp;amp; spices. A North Indian staple-enjoyed by Kings &amp;amp; commoners alike! It makes an excellent main course with hot rice, nan, breads or chapattis. Or serve it an accompaniment to Indian meals.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Aloo Matar

image:image.image:caption: A popular, spicy, potato curry cooked with varying spices in different regions of India. Traditionally eaten with &quot;Puris&quot; (fried, thick, savoury crepes) for breakfast in North India. Alu Raswala is also delightful with nan, white or brown bread &amp;amp; rice. Complement it with piquant pickle &amp;amp; conclude the repast with a hearty Halwa. (Gits Suji Halwa-Indian dessert!)
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Alu Raswala

image:image.image:caption: During the days of British rule in India, Dal Makhani found favour with the connoisseurs of food - the Mughals and Nawabs. A blend of black gram, Bengal gram and red kidney beans are cooked on a slow charcoal fire for upto 16 hours and then delicately tempered and seasoned with exotic spices and light cream, Dal Makhani is by far India`s favourite lentil delicacy.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Dal Makhani

image:image.image:caption: One of India`s favourite lentil delicacies made famous by the &quot;Dhaba&quot; or roadside eatery, Dal Tadka is a preparation of Bangal gram, red gram and soft lentils cooked with fresh herbs, sun dried spices and butter for a smooth textured finish. Blended in onion, tomato and tempered with a sprinkling of green chillies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds and garlic.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Dal Tadka

image:image.image:caption: A very popular vegetable curry made of a combination of fenugreek leaves, green peas &amp;amp; fresh cream. And much liked by connoisseurs. Along with the aromatic taste of the fenugreek leaves and the green peas, the natural delicate flavours of Methi Matar are enhanced by a subtle aroma of spices and seasonings. Its slightly chewy consistency creating a dish which is as tasty as it is wholesome.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Methi Matar

image:image.image:caption: Originating from the kitchen of the Maharaja of Orchreal way back in 1899, Palak Paneer combines fresh spinach and cottage cheese (ricotta) in a creamy curry. A vegetarian dish from the lush green fields of Punjab. &quot;The Land of the Five Rivers&quot;, this puree of tender spinach leaves is slowly simmered with pure cubes of Indian cottage cheese cubes.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Palak Paneer

image:image.image:caption: Paneer Makhani is the darling of India's delicacies originating in the fertile plains of Punjab, &quot;The Land of Five Rivers&quot;. A delightful dish with cottage cheese cubes simmered in a medium spicy tomato gravy sautéed in thick cream, butter and a subtle blend of spices. Best served with rice or Indian bread roti, nan or paratha for a tasty meal that is sure to become one of your favourites.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Paneer Makhani

image:image.image:caption: A delectable union of Moghul and North Indian cuisine, Paneer Tikka Masala is a delicious combination of charcoal grilled Indian cottage cheese (ricotta) cubes in a spicy sauce. The grilled cheese cubes are first marinated in a special mixture of red spices and yoghurt and then roasted slowly in an Indian clay oven called a tandoor.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Paneer Tikka Masala

image:image.image:caption: The original fast food of Bombay, Pau Bhaji literally means bread and mixed vegetables. The &quot;bhaji&quot; i.e. mixed vegetables is a medley of spices and herbs cooked to perfection in large pats of butter and garnished with coarsely chopped fresh coriander leaves and diced onions. The bhaji is served with small loaves of bread called pau.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Pau Bhaji

image:image.image:caption: A favourite from Punjab &quot; The Land of the Five Rivers&quot;, whose people are well known for their zest for life and their wholesome cuisine, Punjabi Chhole is a tangy dish of chickpeas in spiced, thick gravy of onions and tomatoes. Cooked slowly in a special sauce, its sour and tangy taste goes well with pitta bread or dinner rolls - but traditionally so with 'bhatura'.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Punjabi Chhole

image:image.image:caption: A Classic curry from the snow capped mountains of Kashmir-the land the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan described as &quot;Heaven on earth&quot;! Tasty red Kidney beans are simmered slowly in a medium-spicy tomato &amp;amp; onion curry. Savor a gourmet meal of Rajma Masala with fragrant Basmati Rice. Rajma Masala is also yummy with nan bread &amp;amp; chapattis.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Rajma Masala

image:image.image:caption: The crowning glory of India's rice dishes is the Biryani, an elaborate Mughal dish made from spiced saffron rice cooked with vegetables and finely garnished with fresh peas and potatoes. A layered rice dish, it is a one-dish meal that is both nutritious and beautiful to serve.
image:image.image:title: Gits Ready Meals - Veg Biryani

image:image.image:caption: Coca-Cola is the most popular and biggest-selling soft drink in history, as well as the best-known brand in the world. Also the most adored and loved soft drink brand in India where every meal is followed by a glass of coke. With its secret and palatable formula, it can be served anywhere anytime to thrive back the energy wave in the body.

image:image.image:caption: Wheat provides natural health benefits. Complex carbohydrates provide endurance and energy. Amino acids, essential to nutrition, are contained in wheat protein. Fiber aids in digestion and is being studied as a way to prevent type 2-diabetes. Furthermore, wheats folic acid prevents certain birth defects and may lower the risk of heart disease, strokes, and some cancers.
image:image.image:title: Seor Wheat

image:image.image:caption: Chana dal is high in fiber and helps to lower cholesterol. It has a very low glycemic index, which is important for those with diabetes. It is also a good source of zinc, folate, calcium and protein. It contains low fat.
image:image.image:title: Chana Dal

image:image.image:caption: Toor dal contains folic acid, an important vitamin for all women. It is a good source of zinc, folate, calcium and protein. It contains low fat. This dal also has immense amounts of complex dietary fibres that helps to regularise bowel movements.
image:image.image:title: Toor Dal

image:image.image:caption: Tapioca Sago Sabudana is a processed, ready to cook food product. The single raw material for manufacturing Sabudana is Tapioca Root internationally known as Cassava. For infants and sick persons or during fasts (vrata-upawas), Sabudana is considered as best form of nutrition .
image:image.image:title: Sabudana

image:image.image:caption: Eating poha regularly can prevent iron deficiency or anemia as it contains 20 mg of iron in every 100g raw rice flakes. Children as well as pregnant and lactating women can benefit greatly by consuming it.
image:image.image:title: Poha

image:image.image:caption: Sugar is the generalized name for sweet, short-chain, soluble carbohydrates. They are basically carbohydrates, composed of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen. Granulated sugars are mainly used as sprinkle on foods, to sweeten hot drinks and in home baking to add sweetness.

image:image.image:caption: Tata i-Shakti, the solar refined salt brand of Tata Chemicals, brings the goodness of iodine to the masses at an affordable price. i-Shakti has been playing a significant role in mitigating the iodine deficiency of Indian consumers by providing them adequate iodine intake in every pinch of salt.
image:image.image:title: Tata i-Shakti Salt

image:image.image:caption: Nirma Shudh Salt is manufactured using the vacuum drying process. The fully automated process helps in controlling each and every parameter so as to sustain the basic characteristics and quality of the product, with a guarantee of being the best in the quality parameters of iodine content, free flow nature, saltiness, whiteness and the size of the granules.
image:image.image:title: Nirma Shudh Salt

image:image.image:caption: Containing 15 per cent lower sodium than ordinary salt, Tata Salt Lite is also enriched with iodine and potassium. It is generally accepted that lower sodium in diet assists in management of blood pressure.
image:image.image:title: Tata Salt Lite

image:image.image:caption: Tata Salt is credited as being India's first vacuum evaporated iodised salt offering, and today is a household name with top-of-the-mind brand recall. It contains the requisite amount of iodine to ensure proper mental development of children and prevents iodine deficiency disorders in adults. It undergoes stringent quality standards prior to its distribution to different parts of India.
image:image.image:title: Tata Salt

image:image.image:title: Nutrela Soya Chunks
